titles: The life of love let he or she, from chains are free, prize high their liberty. Loves a disease, that seems to please yet breeds captivity. To the tune of, The fair one let me in: or, Busie fame. This may be printed, R.P.
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the Golden Ball in Pye Corner.,
notes: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "All you that do in love delight ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
